   20: 
   21: %% This module tests the ordsets, sets, and gb_sets modules.
   22: %%
   23: 
   24: -module(sets_SUITE).
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   27: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   28: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   29: 	 create/1,add_element/1,del_element/1,
   30: 	 subtract/1,intersection/1,union/1,is_subset/1,
   31: 	 is_equal/1, is_disjoint/1,is_set/1,is_empty/1,fold/1,filter/1,
   32: 	 map/1, filtermap/1, take_smallest/1,take_largest/1, iterate/1]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: 
   36: -import(lists, [foldl/3,reverse/1]).
   37: 
   38: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   39:     Config.
   40: 
   41: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   42:     ok.
   43: 
   44: suite() ->
   45:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   46:      {timetrap,{minutes,5}}].
   47: 
   48: all() -> 
   49:     [create, add_element, del_element, subtract,
   50:      intersection, union, is_subset, is_set, fold, filter, map,
   51:      filtermap, take_smallest, take_largest, iterate, is_empty,
   52:      is_disjoint, is_equal].
   53: 
   54: groups() -> 
   55:     [].
   56: 
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   61:     ok.
   62: 
   63: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   67:     Config.
   68: 
   69: 
   70: create(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   71:     test_all(fun create_1/1).
   72: 
   73: create_1(M) ->
   74:     S0 = M(empty, []),
   75:     [] = M(to_list, S0),
   76:     0 = M(size, S0),
   77:     true = M(is_empty, S0),
   78:     E = make_ref(),
   79:     One = M(singleton, E),
   80:     1 = M(size, One),
   81:     false = M(is_empty, One),
   82:     [E] = M(to_list, One),
   83:     S0.
   84: 
   85: add_element(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   86:     test_all([{0,132},{253,258},{510,514}], fun add_element_1/2).
   87: 
   88: add_element_1(List, M) ->
   89:     S = M(from_list, List),
   90:     SortedSet = lists:usort(List),
   91:     SortedSet = lists:sort(M(to_list, S)),
   92: 
   93:     %% Make sure that we get the same result by inserting
   94:     %% elements one at the time.
   95:     S2 = foldl(fun(El, Set) -> M(add_element, {El,Set}) end,
   96: 	       M(empty, []), List),
   97:     true = M(is_equal, {S,S2}),
   98: 
   99:     %% Insert elements, randomly delete inserted elements,
  100:     %% and re-inserted all deleted elements at the end.
  101:     S3 = add_element_del(List, M, M(empty, []), [], []),
  102:     true = M(is_equal, {S2,S3}),
  103:     true = M(is_equal, {S,S3}),
  104:     S.
  105: 
  106: add_element_del([H|T], M, S, Del, []) ->
  107:     add_element_del(T, M, M(add_element, {H,S}), Del, [H]);
  108: add_element_del([H|T], M, S0, Del, Inserted) ->
  109:     S1 = M(add_element, {H,S0}),
  110:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  111: 	1 ->
  112: 	    OldEl = lists:nth(rand:uniform(length(Inserted)), Inserted),
  113: 	    S = M(del_element, {OldEl,S1}),
  114: 	    add_element_del(T, M, S, [OldEl|Del], [H|Inserted]);
  115: 	_ ->
  116: 	    add_element_del(T, M, S1, Del, [H|Inserted])
  117:     end;
  118: add_element_del([], M, S, Del, _) ->
  119:     M(union, {S,M(from_list, Del)}).
  120: 
  121: del_element(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  122:     test_all([{0,132},{253,258},{510,514},{1022,1026}], fun del_element_1/2).
  123: 
  124: del_element_1(List, M) ->    
  125:     S0 = M(from_list, List),
  126:     Empty = foldl(fun(El, Set) -> M(del_element, {El,Set}) end, S0, List),
  127:     true = M(is_equal, {Empty,M(empty, [])}),
  128:     true = M(is_empty, Empty),
  129:     S1 = foldl(fun(El, Set) ->
  130: 		       M(add_element, {El,Set})
  131: 	       end, S0, reverse(List)),
  132:     true = M(is_equal, {S0,S1}),
  133:     S1.
  134: 
  135: subtract(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  136:     test_all(fun subtract_empty/1),
  137: 
  138:     %% Note: No empty set.
  139:     test_all([{2,69},{126,130},{253,258},511,512,{1023,1030}], fun subtract_1/2).
  140: 
  141: subtract_empty(M) ->
  142:     Empty = M(empty, []),
  143:     true = M(is_empty, M(subtract, {Empty,Empty})),
  144:     M(subtract, {Empty,Empty}).
  145: 
  146: subtract_1(List, M) ->
  147:     S0 = M(from_list, List),
  148:     Empty = M(empty, []),
  149: 
  150:     %% Trivial cases.
  151:     true = M(is_empty, M(subtract, {Empty,S0})),
  152:     true = M(is_equal, {S0,M(subtract, {S0,Empty})}),
  153: 
  154:     %% Not so trivial.
  155:     subtract_check(List, mutate_some(remove_some(List, 0.4)), M),
  156:     subtract_check(List, rnd_list(length(List) div 2 + 5), M),
  157:     subtract_check(List, rnd_list(length(List) div 7 + 9), M),
  158:     subtract_check(List, mutate_some(List), M).
  159: 
  160: subtract_check(A, B, M) ->
  161:     one_subtract_check(B, A, M),
  162:     one_subtract_check(A, B, M).
  163: 
  164: one_subtract_check(A, B, M) ->
  165:     ASorted = lists:usort(A),
  166:     BSorted = lists:usort(B),
  167:     ASet = M(from_list, A),
  168:     BSet = M(from_list, B),
  169:     DiffSet = M(subtract, {ASet,BSet}),
  170:     Diff = ASorted -- BSorted,
  171:     true = M(is_equal, {DiffSet,M(from_list, Diff)}),
  172:     Diff = lists:sort(M(to_list, DiffSet)),
  173:     DiffSet.
  174: 
  175: intersection(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  176:     %% Note: No empty set.
  177:     test_all([{1,65},{126,130},{253,259},{499,513},{1023,1025}], fun intersection_1/2).
  178: 
  179: intersection_1(List, M) ->
  180:     S0 = M(from_list, List),
  181: 
  182:     %% Intersection with self.
  183:     true = M(is_equal, {S0,M(intersection, {S0,S0})}),
  184:     true = M(is_equal, {S0,M(intersection, [S0,S0])}),
  185:     true = M(is_equal, {S0,M(intersection, [S0,S0,S0])}),
  186:     true = M(is_equal, {S0,M(intersection, [S0])}),
  187: 
  188:     %% Intersection with empty.
  189:     Empty = M(empty, []),
  190:     true = M(is_equal, {Empty,M(intersection, {S0,Empty})}),
  191:     true = M(is_equal, {Empty,M(intersection, [S0,Empty,S0,Empty])}),
  192: 
  193:     %% The intersection of no sets is undefined.
  194:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch M(intersection, [])),
  195: 
  196:     %% Disjoint sets.
  197:     Disjoint = [{El} || El <- List],
  198:     DisjointSet = M(from_list, Disjoint),
  199:     true = M(is_empty, M(intersection, {S0,DisjointSet})),
  200: 
  201:     %% Disjoint, different sizes.
  202:     [begin
  203: 	 SomeRemoved = M(from_list, remove_some(Disjoint, HowMuch)),
  204: 	 true = M(is_empty, M(intersection, {S0,SomeRemoved})),
  205: 	 MoreRemoved = M(from_list, remove_some(List, HowMuch)),
  206: 	 true = M(is_empty, M(intersection, {MoreRemoved,DisjointSet}))
  207:      end || HowMuch <- [0.3,0.5,0.7,0.9]],
  208: 
  209:     %% Partial overlap (one or more elements in result set).
  210:     %% The sets have almost the same size. (Almost because a duplicated
  211:     %% element in the original list could be mutated and not mutated
  212:     %% at the same time.)
  213:     PartialOverlap = mutate_some(List, []),
  214:     IntersectionSet = check_intersection(List, PartialOverlap, M),
  215:     false = M(is_empty, IntersectionSet),
  216: 
  217:     %% Partial overlap, different set sizes. (Intersection possibly empty.)
  218:     check_intersection(List, remove_some(PartialOverlap, 0.1), M),
  219:     check_intersection(List, remove_some(PartialOverlap, 0.3), M),
  220:     check_intersection(List, remove_some(PartialOverlap, 0.5), M),
  221:     check_intersection(List, remove_some(PartialOverlap, 0.7), M),
  222:     check_intersection(List, remove_some(PartialOverlap, 0.9), M),
  223: 
  224:     IntersectionSet.
  225: 
  226: check_intersection(Orig, Mutated, M) ->
  227:     OrigSet = M(from_list, Orig),
  228:     MutatedSet = M(from_list, Mutated),
  229:     Intersection = [El || El <- Mutated, not is_tuple(El)],
  230:     SortedIntersection = lists:usort(Intersection),
  231:     IntersectionSet = M(intersection, {OrigSet,MutatedSet}),
  232:     true = M(is_equal, {IntersectionSet,M(from_list, SortedIntersection)}),
  233:     SortedIntersection = lists:sort(M(to_list, IntersectionSet)),
  234: 
  235:     IntersectionSet.
  236: 
  237: 
  238: union(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  239:     %% Note: No empty set.
  240:     test_all([{1,71},{125,129},{254,259},{510,513},{1023,1025}], fun union_1/2).
  241: 
  242: union_1(List, M) ->
  243:     S = M(from_list, List),
  244: 
  245:     %% Union with self and empty.
  246:     Empty = M(empty, []),
  247:     true = M(is_equal, {S,M(union, {S,S})}),
  248:     true = M(is_equal, {S,M(union, [S,S])}),
  249:     true = M(is_equal, {S,M(union, [S,S,Empty])}),
  250:     true = M(is_equal, {S,M(union, [S,Empty,S])}),
  251:     true = M(is_equal, {S,M(union, {S,Empty})}),
  252:     true = M(is_equal, {S,M(union, [S])}),
  253:     true = M(is_empty, M(union, [])),
  254: 
  255:     %% Partial overlap.
  256:     check_union(List, remove_some(mutate_some(List), 0.9), M),
  257:     check_union(List, remove_some(mutate_some(List), 0.7), M),
  258:     check_union(List, remove_some(mutate_some(List), 0.5), M),
  259:     check_union(List, remove_some(mutate_some(List), 0.3), M),
  260:     check_union(List, remove_some(mutate_some(List), 0.1), M),
  261: 
  262:     check_union(List, mutate_some(remove_some(List, 0.9)), M),
  263:     check_union(List, mutate_some(remove_some(List, 0.7)), M),
  264:     check_union(List, mutate_some(remove_some(List, 0.5)), M),
  265:     check_union(List, mutate_some(remove_some(List, 0.3)), M),
  266:     check_union(List, mutate_some(remove_some(List, 0.1)), M).
  267: 
  268: check_union(Orig, Other, M) ->
  269:     OrigSet = M(from_list, Orig),
  270:     OtherSet = M(from_list, Other),
  271:     Union = Orig++Other,
  272:     SortedUnion = lists:usort(Union),
  273:     UnionSet = M(union, {OrigSet,OtherSet}),
  274:     SortedUnion = lists:sort(M(to_list, UnionSet)),
  275:     M(is_equal, {UnionSet,M(from_list, Union)}),
  276:     UnionSet.
  277: 
  278: is_equal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  279:     test_all([{1,132},{253,270},{299,311}], fun is_equal_1/2).
  280: 
  281: is_equal_1(List, M) ->
  282:     S = M(from_list, List),
  283:     Empty = M(empty, []),
  284: 
  285:     true = M(is_equal, {Empty, Empty}),
  286:     false = M(is_equal, {Empty, S}) andalso List =/= [],
  287:     false = M(is_equal, {S, Empty}) andalso List =/= [],
  288:     true = M(is_equal, {S, S}),
  289: 
  290:     S1 = M(from_list, [make_ref()|List]),
  291:     false = M(is_equal, {S, S1}),
  292: 
  293:     S.
  294: 
  295: is_subset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  296:     test_all([{1,132},{253,270},{299,311}], fun is_subset_1/2).
  297: 
  298: is_subset_1(List, M) ->
  299:     S = M(from_list, List),
  300:     Empty = M(empty, []),
  301: 
  302:     %% Subset of empty and self.
  303:     true = M(is_subset, {Empty,Empty}),
  304:     true = M(is_subset, {Empty,S}),
  305:     false = M(is_subset, {S,Empty}),
  306:     true = M(is_subset, {S,S}),
  307: 
  308:     %% Other cases.
  309:     Res = [false = M(is_subset, {M(singleton, make_ref()),S}),
  310: 	   true = M(is_subset, {M(singleton, hd(List)),S}),
  311: 	   true = check_subset(remove_some(List, 0.1), List, M),
  312: 	   true = check_subset(remove_some(List, 0.5), List, M),
  313: 	   true = check_subset(remove_some(List, 0.9), List, M),
  314: 	   check_subset(mutate_some(List), List, M),
  315: 	   check_subset(rnd_list(length(List) div 2 + 5), List, M),
  316: 	   subtract_check(List, rnd_list(length(List) div 7 + 9), M)
  317: 	  ],
  318:     res_to_set(Res, M, 0, []).
  319: 
  320: is_disjoint(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  321:     test_all([{1,132},{253,270},{299,311}], fun is_disjoint_1/2).
  322: 
  323: is_disjoint_1(List, M) ->
  324:     S = M(from_list, List),
  325:     Empty = M(empty, []),
  326: 
  327:     true = M(is_disjoint, {Empty,Empty}),
  328:     true = M(is_disjoint, {Empty,S}),
  329:     true = M(is_disjoint, {S,Empty}),
  330:     false = M(is_disjoint, {S,S}),
  331: 
  332:     true = M(is_disjoint, {M(singleton, make_ref()),S}),
  333:     true = M(is_disjoint, {S,M(singleton, make_ref())}),
  334:     S.
  335: 
  336: check_subset(X, Y, M) ->
  337:     check_one_subset(Y, X, M),
  338:     check_one_subset(X, Y, M).
  339: 
  340: check_one_subset(X, Y, M) ->
  341:     XSet = M(from_list, X),
  342:     YSet = M(from_list, Y),
  343:     SortedX = lists:usort(X),
  344:     SortedY = lists:usort(Y),
  345:     IsSubSet = length(SortedY--SortedX) =:= length(SortedY) - length(SortedX),
  346:     IsSubSet = M(is_subset, {XSet,YSet}),
  347:     IsSubSet.
  348: 
  349: %% Encode all test results as a set to return.
  350: res_to_set([true|T], M, I, Acc) ->
  351:     res_to_set(T, M, I+1, [I|Acc]);
  352: res_to_set([_|T], M, I, Acc) ->
  353:     res_to_set(T, M, I+1, Acc);
  354: res_to_set([], M, _, Acc) -> M(from_list, Acc).
  355: 
  356: is_set(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  357:     %% is_set/1 is tested in the other test cases when its argument
  358:     %% is a set. Here test some arguments that makes it return false.
  359: 
  360:     false = gb_sets:is_set([a,b]),
  361:     false = gb_sets:is_set({a,very,bad,tuple}),
  362: 
  363:     false = sets:is_set([a,b]),
  364:     false = sets:is_set({a,very,bad,tuple}),
  365: 
  366:     false = ordsets:is_set([b,a]),
  367:     false = ordsets:is_set({bad,tuple}),
  368: 
  369:     %% Now test values that are known to be bad for all set representations.
  370:     test_all(fun is_set_1/1).
  371: 
  372: is_set_1(M) ->
  373:     false = M(is_set, self()),
  374:     false = M(is_set, blurf),
  375:     false = M(is_set, make_ref()),
  376:     false = M(is_set, <<1,2,3>>),
  377:     false = M(is_set, 42),
  378:     false = M(is_set, math:pi()),
  379:     false = M(is_set, {}),
  380:     M(empty, []).
  381: 
  382: is_empty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  383:     test_all(fun is_empty_1/1).
  384: 
  385: is_empty_1(M) ->
  386:     S = M(from_list, [blurf]),
  387:     Empty = M(empty, []),
  388: 
  389:     true = M(is_empty, Empty),
  390:     false = M(is_empty, S),
  391:     M(empty, []).
  392: 
  393: fold(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  394:     test_all([{0,71},{125,129},{254,259},{510,513},{1023,1025},{9999,10001}],
  395: 	     fun fold_1/2).
  396: 
  397: fold_1(List, M) ->
  398:     S = M(from_list, List),
  399:     L = M(fold, {fun(E, A) -> [E|A] end,[],S}),
  400:     true = lists:sort(L) =:= lists:usort(List),
  401:     M(empty, []).
  402: 
  403: filter(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  404:     test_all([{0,69},{126,130},{254,259},{510,513},{1023,1025},{7999,8000}],
  405: 	     fun filter_1/2).
  406: 
  407: filter_1(List, M) ->
  408:     S = M(from_list, List),
  409:     IsNumber = fun(X) -> is_number(X) end,
  410:     M(is_equal, {M(from_list, lists:filter(IsNumber, List)),
  411: 	      M(filter, {IsNumber,S})}),
  412:     M(filter, {fun(X) -> is_atom(X) end,S}).
  413: 
  414: map(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  415:     test_all([{0,69},{126,130},{254,259},{510,513},{1023,1025},{7999,8000}],
  416: 	     fun map_1/2).
  417: 
  418: map_1(List, M) ->
  419:     S = M(from_list, List),
  420:     ToTuple = fun(X) -> {X} end,
  421:     M(is_equal, {M(from_list, lists:map(ToTuple, List)),
  422: 	         M(map, {ToTuple, S})}),
  423:     M(map, {fun(_) -> x end, S}).
  424: 
  425: filtermap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  426:     test_all([{0,69},{126,130},{254,259},{510,513},{1023,1025},{7999,8000}],
  427: 	     fun filtermap_1/2).
  428: 
  429: filtermap_1(List, M) ->
  430:     S = M(from_list, List),
  431:     FMFun = fun
  432:                 (X) when is_float(X) -> false;
  433: 		(X) when is_integer(X) -> true;
  434: 		(X) -> {true, {X}}
  435:             end,
  436:     M(is_equal, {M(from_list, lists:filtermap(FMFun, List)),
  437: 	         M(filtermap, {FMFun, S})}),
  438:     M(empty, []).
  439: 
  440: %%%
  441: %%% Test specifics for gb_sets.
  442: %%%
  443: 
  444: take_smallest(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  445:     test_all([{1,71},{125,129},{254,259},{510,513},{1023,1025}],
  446: 	     fun take_smallest_1/2).
  447: 
  448: take_smallest_1(List, M) ->
  449:     case M(module, []) of
  450: 	gb_sets -> take_smallest_2(List, M);
  451: 	_ -> ok
  452:     end,
  453:     M(empty, []).
  454: 
  455: take_smallest_2(List0, M) ->
  456:     List = lists:usort(List0),
  457:     S = M(from_list, List0),
  458:     take_smallest_3(S, List, M).
  459: 
  460: take_smallest_3(S0, List0, M) ->
  461:     case M(is_empty, S0) of
  462: 	true -> ok;
  463: 	false ->
  464: 	    Smallest = hd(List0),
  465: 	    Smallest = gb_sets:smallest(S0),
  466: 	    {Smallest,S} = gb_sets:take_smallest(S0),
  467: 	    List = tl(List0),
  468: 	    true = gb_sets:to_list(S) =:= List,
  469: 	    take_smallest_3(S, List, M)
  470:     end.
  471: 
  472: take_largest(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  473:     test_all([{1,71},{125,129},{254,259},{510,513},{1023,1025}],
  474: 	     fun take_largest_1/2).
  475: 
  476: take_largest_1(List, M) ->
  477:     case M(module, []) of
  478: 	gb_sets -> take_largest_2(List, M);
  479: 	_ -> ok
  480:     end,
  481:     M(empty, []).
  482: 
  483: take_largest_2(List0, M) ->
  484:     List = reverse(lists:usort(List0)),
  485:     S = M(from_list, List0),
  486:     take_largest_3(S, List, M).
  487: 
  488: take_largest_3(S0, List0, M) ->
  489:     case M(is_empty, S0) of
  490: 	true -> ok;
  491: 	false ->
  492: 	    Largest = hd(List0),
  493: 	    Largest = gb_sets:largest(S0),
  494: 	    {Largest,S} = gb_sets:take_largest(S0),
  495: 	    List = tl(List0),
  496: 	    true = gb_sets:to_list(S) =:= reverse(List),
  497: 	    take_largest_3(S, List, M)
  498:     end.
  499: 
  500: iterate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  501:     test_all(fun iterate_1/1).
  502: 
  503: iterate_1(M) ->
  504:     case M(module, []) of
  505: 	gb_sets -> iterate_2(M);
  506: 	_ -> ok
  507:     end,
  508:     M(empty, []).
  509: 
  510: iterate_2(M) ->
  511:     rand:seed(exsplus, {1,2,42}),
  512:     iter_set(M, 1000).
  513: 
  514: iter_set(_M, 0) ->
  515:     ok;
  516: iter_set(M, N) ->
  517:     L = [I || I <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  518:     T = M(from_list, L),
  519:     L = lists:reverse(iterate_set(M, T)),
  520:     R = rand:uniform(N),
  521:     S = lists:reverse(iterate_set(M, R, T)),
  522:     S = [E || E <- L, E >= R],
  523:     iter_set(M, N-1).
  524: 
  525: iterate_set(M, Set) ->
  526:     I = M(iterator, Set),
  527:     iterate_set_1(M, M(next, I), []).
  528: 
  529: iterate_set(M, Start, Set) ->
  530:     I = M(iterator_from, {Start, Set}),
  531:     iterate_set_1(M, M(next, I), []).
  532: 
  533: iterate_set_1(_, none, R) ->
  534:     R;
  535: iterate_set_1(M, {E, I}, R) ->
  536:     iterate_set_1(M, M(next, I), [E | R]).
  537: 
  538: %%%
  539: %%% Helper functions.
  540: %%%
  541: 
  542: sets_mods() ->
  543:     Ordsets = sets_test_lib:new(ordsets, fun(X, Y) -> X == Y end),
  544: 
  545:     NewSets = sets_test_lib:new(sets, fun(X, Y) -> X == Y end,
  546: 				fun() -> sets:new([{version,2}]) end,
  547: 				fun(X) -> sets:from_list(X, [{version,2}]) end),
  548: 
  549:     MixSets = sets_test_lib:new(sets, fun(X, Y) ->
  550: 				           lists:sort(sets:to_list(X)) ==
  551: 				               lists:sort(sets:to_list(Y)) end,
  552: 				fun mixed_new/0, fun mixed_from_list/1),
  553: 
  554:     OldSets = sets_test_lib:new(sets, fun(X, Y) ->
  555: 					   lists:sort(sets:to_list(X)) ==
  556: 					       lists:sort(sets:to_list(Y)) end,
  557: 				fun sets:new/0, fun sets:from_list/1),
  558: 
  559:     Gb = sets_test_lib:new(gb_sets, fun(X, Y) ->
  560: 					    gb_sets:to_list(X) ==
  561: 						gb_sets:to_list(Y) end),
  562:     [Ordsets,OldSets,MixSets,NewSets,Gb].
  563: 
  564: mixed_new() ->
  565:     case erlang:erase(sets_type) of
  566:         undefined -> erlang:put(sets_type, deprecated), sets:new([{version,2}]);
  567:         deprecated -> sets:new()
  568:     end.
  569: 
  570: mixed_from_list(L) ->
  571:     case erlang:erase(sets_type) of
  572:         undefined -> erlang:put(sets_type, deprecated), sets:from_list(L, [{version,2}]);
  573:         deprecated -> sets:from_list(L)
  574:     end.
  575: 
  576: test_all(Tester) ->
  577:     Res = [begin
  578: 	       rand:seed(exsplus, {1,2,42}),
  579: 	       S = Tester(M),
  580: 	       {M(size, S),lists:sort(M(to_list, S))}
  581: 	   end || M <- sets_mods()],
  582:     all_same(Res).
  583: 
  584: test_all([{Low,High}|T], Tester) ->
  585:     test_all(lists:seq(Low, High)++T, Tester);
  586: test_all([Sz|T], Tester) when is_integer(Sz) ->
  587:     List = rnd_list(Sz),
  588:     Res = [begin
  589: 		     rand:seed(exsplus, {19,2,Sz}),
  590: 		     S = Tester(List, M),
  591: 		     {M(size, S),lists:sort(M(to_list, S))}
  592: 		 end || M <- sets_mods()],
  593:     all_same(Res),
  594:     test_all(T, Tester);
  595: test_all([], _) -> ok.
  596: 
  597: 
  598: all_same([H|T]) ->
  599:     all_same_1(T, H).
  600: 
  601: all_same_1([H|T], H) ->
  602:     all_same_1(T, H);
  603: all_same_1([], _) -> ok.
  604: 
  605: rnd_list(Sz) ->
  606:     rnd_list_1(Sz, []).
  607:     
  608: atomic_rnd_term() ->
  609:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  610: 	1 -> list_to_atom(integer_to_list($\s+rand:uniform(94))++"rnd");
  611: 	2 -> rand:uniform();
  612: 	3 -> rand:uniform(50)-37
  613:     end.
  614: 
  615: rnd_list_1(0, Acc) -> Acc;
  616: rnd_list_1(N, Acc) -> rnd_list_1(N-1, [atomic_rnd_term()|Acc]).
  617: 
  618: mutate_some(List) ->
  619:     mutate_some(List, []).
  620:     
  621: mutate_some([X,Y,Z|T], Acc) ->
  622:     %% Intentionally change order. (Order should not matter.)
  623:     mutate_some(T, [{X},Z,Y|Acc]);
  624: mutate_some([H|T], Acc) ->
  625:     mutate_some(T, [H|Acc]);
  626: mutate_some([], Acc) ->
  627:     %% Intentionally not reversing.
  628:     Acc.
  629: 
  630: %% Removes at least one element.
  631: remove_some(List0, P) ->
  632:     case remove_some(List0, P, []) of
  633: 	List when length(List0) =:= length(List) ->
  634: 	    tl(List);
  635: 	List ->
  636: 	    List
  637:     end.
  638: 
  639: remove_some([H|T], P, Acc) ->
  640:     case rand:uniform() of
  641: 	F when F < P ->				%Remove.
  642: 	    remove_some(T, P, Acc);
  643: 	_ ->
  644: 	    remove_some(T, P, [H|Acc])
  645:     end;
  646: remove_some([], _, Acc) ->
  647:     %% Intentionally no reverse. Order should not matter.
  648:     Acc.
